tasks.description: Parse user input to extract intent, entities, and context (e.g., location, time, subject).
Determine the appropriate external API(s) to satisfy the intent and construct the correct request.
Retrieve, combine, and transform data from the chosen API(s) into a unified structure.
Generate a concise, user‑friendly response in natural language that incorporates the retrieved data.
Return available job postings at selected retail locations
Track and expose user presence (online/offline) to Linda AI.
Persist chat messages to QuickBlox cloud storage for history retrieval.
Create a new blog post on behalf of the user
Create a new gadget within the user's Hyves account
Connect to external news APIs to fetch recent articles from specified high‑quality newspapers.
Connect to a location‑based service to retrieve current news hot spots around the world.
Map retrieved articles to corresponding hot spot locations for visualization.
Provide filtering and sorting options (e.g., by source, date, location).
Render the aggregated news list and hotspot map in the front‑end of the Scoopmap website.
Store user bookmarked news links using a bookmark service.
Geocoding plant location data and rendering interactive maps showing plant distribution
Connecting to Instagram API to publish plant images, captions, and location tags
Implementing image recognition for plant species identification (AI classification)
Providing user accounts, forums, and comment sections for community knowledge exchange
Enable user contributions of new plant sightings, comments, and ratings.
Provide geospatial search and filtering of plant occurrences on the map.
Generate analytics on plant distribution and user engagement.
Ensure robust data storage, backup, and retrieval of plant records and media.
Maintain a RESTful API for external clients to query plant data
Support image hosting and retrieval for plant photos
Host and serve photo content efficiently.
Manage API keys, rate limits, and secure connections to Instagram and Google Maps services.
Implement a search endpoint that accepts a query (song title or keyword) and returns matching soundtrack entries
Provide a lookup endpoint that returns detailed information about a specific song, including the movie it appears in
Enable personalized recommendation suggestions using user demographic or listening data.
Create a front‑end user interface for users to interact with the search and detail views.
Provide optional media playback or link generation for tracks that are licensed for preview streaming.
Ingest and store incident data (timestamp, location, severity, injuries, casualties) using a ticketing or custom data system.
Compute and visualize response-time statistics (average, median, distribution) per incident and per team.
Analyze injury severity and casualty demographics (age, gender, medical condition) across incidents.
Generate a heatmap of hotspot clusters by aggregating incident locations and identifying high-risk zones.
Export comprehensive analytical reports in PDF/CSV and provide API access for dashboards.
Provide interactive dashboards and reports summarizing key metrics and trends.
Manage emergency response teams, roster members, and auto-assign teams to incidents based on proximity and skill.
Send real‑time alerts to assigned teams when new incidents match high‑risk patterns.
Validate the meeting status with the originator and confirm it is still scheduled.
Retrieve the phone numbers of all registered participants for the meeting.
Initiate or coordinate a conference bridge (voice call) that connects all participants.
If participants cannot be reached, send an SMS containing a temporary call‑in number and secure PIN.
If a participant cannot be reached by voice, send an SMS with a temporary conference call‑in number and a secure PIN.
Provide in‑app chat messages to notify participants of call status and updates.
Orchestrate the actual conference bridge session (connect calls together)
Call Dribbble API to obtain a random selection of 3 images
Generate and serve refresh functionality that re-requests a new random set
Construct URLs that redirect to the individual Dribbble image pages
Implement a refresh button that triggers a new API call and updates the displayed images.
Make each image clickable, opening the corresponding Dribbble shot page.
Create, edit, and delete groups and manage member memberships
Schedule events, set dates/times, add details, and publish to group members
Deliver communications to selected channels (SMS/text, email, push, social media) for specific group or event
Integrate with external communication services (SMS gateways, email APIs, phone call providers)
Assign roles and permissions to leaders and members, manage access control
Manage group membership (add/remove members, handle roles).
Post updates to social media platforms on behalf of the group
Retrieve structured location data (addresses, coordinates, categories) for event venues
Authenticate group leaders and manage permissions.
Integrate mobile (iPad) app functionality with the backend services.
Send text messages (SMS) to members
Send email invitations
Send phone call notifications
Post updates to social media platforms
Create and store a patron entry in the waitlist
Determine the next patron in the queue and retrieve their contact information
Send a text (SMS) message to the patron notifying them that it is their turn
Remove a patron from the queue once they have been served
Support administrative actions such as clearing the queue or cancelling patron entries
Schedule and orchestrate the notification workflow (e.g., using cloud functions or cron jobs).
Determine the user's current location using IP geolocation or user input.
Call Google's Weather API to fetch the current weather conditions for that location.
Format and deliver the weather data as spoken output or text to the user.
Optionally convert the formatted weather details into spoken audio for the user.
Convert the textual summary into audio (speech) and deliver it to the user.
Deliver the spoken audio back to the user through the mashup interface.
Retrieve Twitter posts within a specified radius of a given latitude/longitude.
Retrieve Foursquare check‑in or review posts within a specified radius of a given latitude/longitude.
Retrieve Geosay posts within a specified radius of a given latitude/longitude.
Calculate the distance between each post’s coordinates and the target location.
Order the combined results from all sources by ascending distance.
Combine sorted results into a unified, location‑ordered feed for the end user.
Aggregate the sorted results into a unified feed for the frontend.
Identify and retrieve a list of Twitter users that match a location-based query and contain specified keywords in Bio or Location.
Execute a bulk follow action to follow each user in the retrieved list.
Send bulk follow requests to selected users while respecting API rate limits and user preferences
Perform bulk follow actions for the filtered users.
Provide feedback to the user about the outcome of each follow action
Provide a user interface or API wrapper for developers to integrate LocaFollow into their applications.
Fetch friends' profile pictures and photos from Twitter and LiveJournal accounts.
Create a mosaic image by arranging the retrieved photos into a cohesive design.
Provide an interface to select merchandise and process orders for printing the mosaic.
Export the final mosaic as print‑ready files (e.g., TIFF/PNG) compatible with various merchandise templates
Provide an ordering interface that lets users choose product type, size, and place payment
Create a front‑end product selection and checkout flow for the user to order the printed item.
Process the payment and send the order details to the print service.
Fetch all publicly available bus routes and their timetables for Darwin.
Retrieve a comprehensive list of bus stops, with geolocation and operational details.
Collect real-time traffic and bus location data to inform the user of current conditions.
Obtain StreetView imagery for each bus stop to provide visual context.
Fetch StreetView images for each bus stop location
Show StreetView images for each bus stop
Allow timeline navigation through scheduled stops
Retrieve and render a Google Map with markers for all specified locations.
Fetch current tide data for each location and display it on the map.
Calculate sun and moon times, as well as moon phase, for each location.
Generate best fishing and solunar times based on astronomical data.
Obtain a representative photo for each location to display in the detail view.
Render an interactive Google Map overlay that marks locations and shows tide-related data.
Ensure data refresh and caching mechanisms accommodate high request volume.
Provide a detailed information panel per location that consolidates tide, astronomy, fishing, and photo data.
Retrieve and store geographic coordinates for each of the 7 wonders.
Render a Google Map with markers placed at the coordinates from T1.
Search and fetch the top YouTube video for each wonder.
Integrate map and video information into a cohesive web or mobile UI.
Provide navigation or additional informational content (descriptions, photos) for each wonder.
Manage API interactions, including authentication and request handling for Google Maps and YouTube.
Query the job database for positions related to 'tennis' within US job listings.
Geocode each job's address to obtain latitude and longitude.
Restrict the returned job set to the first 50 results.
Format the data so it can be consumed by a map visualization component.
Provide an API or data format that can be consumed by a map library (e.g., Leaflet, Google Maps) to display markers.
Provide UI elements for filtering and interacting with job markers.
Search for venues matching category criteria within a specified geographic radius
Retrieve latitude and longitude for each venue to plot on a map interface
Present the list of nearby venues to the user via a visual map or list
Display the filtered venues on an interactive map with markers and pop‑ups containing venue details.
Allow keyword search for venues by name or description
Determine the nearest venues to a supplied coordinate (requires external venue data)
Retrieve episode summaries, plot details, and associated images for the TV show 24.
Integrate discussion board functionality so users can comment and discuss each waypoint or episode segment.
Create and manage discussion boards/forums tied to each waypoint for community interaction
Integrate the above data into a unified user interface that supports navigation and interaction
Allow users to submit new discussion posts via the Contentful API and persist them as entries.
Retrieve images and plot details for the TV show episodes
